com.academiken.framegrabm.util
Class GrabCoreFormat

java.lang.Object
  com.academiken.framegrabm.util.GrabCoreFormat
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class GrabCoreFormat
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

GrabCoreFormat is a format, or capability, that is returned by the LTI-Civil VideoFormat object. Each device will produce one or more formats, and the format can be selected with GrabCore.setFormat() before acquiring video frames. (It is also important to call GrabCore.setDevice() before calling GrabCore.setFormat()).

Version:
0.8 - 06 March 2012
Author:
Kenneth Perrine

Field Summary
 java.lang.String description
          description is a friendly, displayable string that describes the format.
 int deviceIndex
          deviceIndex is the index of the device that corresponds with this format.

 float frameRate
          frameRate is the number of frames per second (FPS) that the device operates at for this format.
 int height
          height is the height of the frame in pixels.

          type is the color format.

Field Detail

description

public java.lang.String description
description is a friendly, displayable string that describes the format.

type

public java.lang.String type
type is the color format. The only one that has been tested is "RGB24".

width

public int width
width is the width of the frame for this format in pixels.

height

public int height
height is the height of the frame in pixels.

frameRate

public float frameRate
frameRate is the number of frames per second (FPS) that the device operates at for this format. Note that since the current feature of FrameGrabM is to grab individual frames, the overhead of MATLAB may cause the effective frame rate to be considerably less.

formatIndex

public int formatIndex
formatIndex is the index of the format that would be used in the GrabCore.setFormat() method.

deviceIndex

public int deviceIndex
deviceIndex is the index of the device that corresponds with this format. This is useful if cell arrays from multiple devices are combined together.
